intro: Corispermum sibiricum subsp. baicalense, commonly known as the Baical sandmat, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the cold climates of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in dense clusters, typically blooming in the summer months. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the flora in its native habitat.
